register.name: BOOT_CFG0
register.description: Boot configuration word0. Shadow register is present for this word thus SW could access the register directly to read contents.

bit_field.name: PRIMARY_BOOT_SOURCE
bit_field.description: Primary boot source. (a.k.a. Master boot source)

bit_field_value.name: ISP_PIN_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: ISP pins will determine boot source.

bit_field_value.name: FLEXSPI_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot from Flex-SPI flash device using FlexSpi interface pins.

bit_field_value.name: SPI_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot using SPI slave interface using master boot mode.

bit_field_value.name: UART_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot using UART interface using master boot mode.

bit_field_value.name: SPI_FC_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot from 1-bit SPI flash device from FlexCom interface pins selected by REDUNDANT_SPI_PORT field. Only load-to-RAM images are supported in this mode.

bit_field_value.name: ISP_MODE
bit_field_value.description: Always enter ISP mode. DEFAULT_ISP_MODE field will determine the ISP interface.

bit_field_value.name: QSPI_FALLBACK_SPINOR_BOOT
bit_field_value.description: Boot from Octal/Quad SPI flash device using FlexSPI channel A interface pins. If image is not found check recovery boot using SPI-flash device through FlexComm.

bit_field.name: DEFAULT_ISP_MODE
bit_field.description: ISP boot mode

bit_field_value.name: AUTO_ISP
bit_field_value.description: Auto detect ISP mode. The RW61x/ probes the active peripheral from one of the below serial interfaces and download image from the probed peripherals:UART, I2C, SPI, USB-HID

bit_field_value.name: USB_HID_ISP
bit_field_value.description: The USB HID class is used to download the image of the USB0 port

bit_field_value.name: UART_ISP
bit_field_value.description: Support ISP command interface on UART port only.

bit_field_value.name: SPI_ISP
bit_field_value.description: Support ISP command interface on SPI port only.

bit_field_value.name: I2C_ISP
bit_field_value.description: Support ISP command interface on I2C port only.

bit_field_value.name: DISABLE_ISP
bit_field_value.description: Disable ISP fall through when proper image is not found on primary boot device.

bit_field.name: BOOT_CLK_SPEED
bit_field.description: Defines clock speeds during boot.

bit_field.name: STOP_ON_FAILURE
bit_field.description: If set, then enables GPIO Port and PIN information upon failure

bit_field.name: TZM_IMAGE_TYPE
bit_field.description: TrustZone-M mode

bit_field_value.name: ENFORCE_PRESET_VALUE
bit_field_value.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

bit_field_value.name: ENFORCE_PRESET_VALUE
bit_field_value.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

bit_field_value.name: ENFORCE_PRESET_VALUE
bit_field_value.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

bit_field.name: REDUNDANT_SPI_PORT
bit_field.description: FlexComm port to use for redundant SPI flash boot.

bit_field_value.name: FC0
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom0 pins P0_0 (SCK), P0_1 (MISO), P0_2 (MOSI), P0_3 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC1
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom1 pins P0_7 (SCK), P0_8 (MISO), P0_9 (MOSI), P0_10 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC2
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom2 pins P0_14 (SCK), P0_15 (MISO), P0_16 (MOSI), P0_17 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC3
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom3 pins P0_21 (SCK), P0_22 (MISO), P0_23 (MOSI), P0_24 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC4
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom4 pins P0_28 (SCK), P0_29 (MISO), P0_30 (MOSI), P0_31 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC5
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom5 pins P1_3 (SCK), P1_4 (MISO), P1_5 (MOSI), P1_6 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC6
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom6 pins P3_25 (SCK), P3_26 (MISO), P3_27 (MOSI), P3_28 (SEL)

bit_field_value.name: FC7
bit_field_value.description: Use FlexCom7 pins P4_0 (SCK), P4_1 (MISO), P4_2 (MOSI), P4_3 (SEL)

bit_field.name: SECURE_BOOT_EN
bit_field.description: Secure boot enable config

bit_field_value.name: DISABLED
bit_field_value.description: Allow non-secure images with and without CRC. Used during development.

bit_field_value.name: ENABLED
bit_field_value.description: Secure boot is enabled. Do complete ECDSA checking of signed images. (ECDSA signed)

bit_field_value.name: ENABLED
bit_field_value.description: Secure boot is enabled. Do complete ECDSA checking of signed images. (ECDSA signed)

bit_field.name: DICE_INC_OTP
bit_field.description: Include OTP fuses area in DICE computation

bit_field.name: DICE_SKIP
bit_field.description: Skip DICE computation

bit_field.name: BOOT_FAIL_PORT
bit_field.description: GPIO port number to use for indicating boot failure. Defines GPIO port number

bit_field.name: BOOT_FAIL_PIN
bit_field.description: Defines GPIO pin number.

register.name: BOOT_CFG1
register.description: Boot configuration word specifying FlexSPI flash devices settings.

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN
bit_field.description: Flash auto probe feature enable. Auto probing is enabled if the bit is 1.

bit_field_value.name: FLASH_AUTO_PROBE
bit_field_value.description: , Boot ROM looks for a FCB on the Flash. Boot ROM reads a 512 byte FCB into on-chip SRAM and configures the FlexSPI controller accordingly.

bit_field_value.name: FCB_FROM_FLASH
bit_field_value.description: the Boot ROM will perform Flash auto probe sequence using parameters from OTP fuse values for FLEXSPI_PROBE_TYPE, FLEXSPI_FLASH_TYPE, FLEXSPI_DUMMY_CYCLES, FLEXSPI_FREQUENCY

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_PROBE_TYPE
bit_field.description: Flash probe type

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_FLASH_TYPE
bit_field.description: Flash type. This field affects the default configuration of the Boot ROM Flash driver (before any input from Flash itself is available)

bit_field_value.name: FLEXSPI_SDR_3B
bit_field_value.description: Device supports SDR and uses 3 byte addresses for read. In case of autoprobing, when generating an FCB from the SFDP information, commands for SRD operation are generated. In case of configuration from FCB, for reading of Flash memory, command 0x03 is used.

bit_field_value.name: FLEXSPI_DDR_4B
bit_field_value.description: Device supports DDR and uses 4 byte addresses for read. In case of autoprobing, when generating an FCB from the SFDP information, the command set for DDR operation is used. In case of configuration from FCB, for reading of Flash memory, command 0x13 is used.

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_DUMMY_CYCLES
bit_field.description: Dummy cycles for read command

bit_field_value.name: AUTO_PROB
bit_field_value.description: The dummy cycles are probed automatically.

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_FREQUENCY
bit_field.description: Flash SPI clock frequency to use for auto probing.

bit_field_value.name: FLEXSPI_100MHZ
bit_field_value.description: Use a clock frequency of 100 MHz.

bit_field_value.name: FLEXSPI_120MHZ
bit_field_value.description: Use a clock frequency of 120 MHz

bit_field_value.name: FLEXSPI_133MHZ
bit_field_value.description: Use a clock frequency of 133 MHz

bit_field_value.name: FLEXSPI_166MHZ
bit_field_value.description: Use a clock frequency of 166 MHz

bit_field_value.name: FLEXSPI_200MHZ
bit_field_value.description: Use a clock frequency of 200 MHz

bit_field_value.name: FLEXSPI_80MHZ
bit_field_value.description: Use a clock frequency of 80 MHz

bit_field_value.name: FLEXSPI_60MHZ
bit_field_value.description: Use a clock frequency of 60 MHz

bit_field_value.name: FLEXSPI_50MHZ
bit_field_value.description: Use a clock frequency of 50 MHz

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_RST_SEQ
bit_field.description: Select the Flash reset sequence to use for regular boot.

bit_field_value.name: JEDEC_RESET
bit_field_value.description: The Boot ROM performs a reset sequence according to the JEDEC specification.

bit_field_value.name: RESET_COMMAND
bit_field_value.description: The Boot ROM sends commands for resetting the Flash. The sequence is fixed command byte 0x66 (enable reset) followed by command byte 0x99 (reset device) using SPI (single wire).

bit_field_value.name: WAKEUP_COMMAND
bit_field_value.description: The Boot ROM sends a wakeup command to the Flash. The sequence is fixed command byte 0xAB using SPI (single wire). As the wakeup command is using SPI, it has to be ensured that the Flash is in a mode where it can accept SPI commands before the system is put to low-power mode.

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_RST_HOLD_TIME
bit_field.description: Set the time to wait after reset sequence for regular boot.

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_WUP_SEQ
bit_field.description: Select the Flash reset sequence to use for boot from low power mode.

bit_field_value.name: JEDEC_RESET
bit_field_value.description: The Boot ROM performs a reset sequence according to the JEDEC specification.

bit_field_value.name: RESET_COMMAND
bit_field_value.description: The Boot ROM sends commands for resetting the Flash. The sequence is fixed command byte 0x66 (enable reset) followed by command byte 0x99 (reset device) using SPI (single wire).

bit_field_value.name: WAKEUP_COMMAND
bit_field_value.description: The Boot ROM sends a wakeup command to the Flash. The sequence is fixed command byte 0xAB using SPI (single wire). As the wakeup command is using SPI, it has to be ensured that the Flash is in a mode where it can accept SPI commands before the system is put to low-power mode.

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_WUP_HOLD_TIME
bit_field.description: Set the time to wait after reset sequence for boot from low power mode.

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_HOLD_TIME
bit_field.description: Wait time before access to Serial Flash.

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME
bit_field.description: Delay after POR before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices in addition to delay defined by QSPI_HOLD TIME field.

register.name: BOOT_CFG2
register.description: Boot configuration word specifiying settings for flexspi image

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_IMAGE_SIZE
bit_field.description: The size of the Flash memory to use for a boot image

bit_field_value.name: SIZE_OFFSET
bit_field_value.description: The size of the boot image is considered to be equal to the offset of the second image.

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_DELAY_CELL_NUM
bit_field.description: Delay cell numbers for Flash read sampling via DQS (either internal loopback or external DQS)

bit_field.name: FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET
bit_field.description: The offset in Flash memory where the second boot image starts. The offset to the second image is X * 256 KiB.

register.name: BOOT_CFG3
register.description: Boot configuration word3. Shadow register is present for this word thus SW could access the register directly to read contents.

bit_field_value.description: Usable as debug CA, image CA, FW CA, image and FW key.

bit_field_value.name: ImageCA_FwCA
bit_field_value.description: Usable as image (boot and FW) CA only.

bit_field_value.name: DebugCA_ImageCA_FwCA
bit_field_value.description: Usable as debug, boot and FW image CA.

bit_field_value.name: FwKey

bit_field_value.name: FwKey

bit_field.name: ROTK3_USAGE

bit_field_value.name: DebugCA_ImageCA_FwCA_ImageKey_FwKey
bit_field_value.description: Usable as debug CA, image CA, FW CA, image and FW key.

bit_field_value.name: ImageCA_FwCA
bit_field_value.description: Usable as image (boot and FW) CA only.

bit_field.name: ENF_CNSA
bit_field.description: Enforce CNSA (Commercial National Security Algorithm) suite keys

bit_field.name: ENABLE_CRC_CHECK
bit_field.description: Enable CRC checks over OTP words

bit_field.name: FIPS_KDF_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for CKDF block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in BOOT_STATE register.

bit_field_value.name: SKIP_SELF_TEEST_RUN
bit_field_value.description: Self-tests run is skipped and results are not included.

bit_field.name: FIPS_CMAC_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for CMAC block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in BOOT_STATE register.

bit_field_value.name: SKIP_SELF_TEEST_RUN
bit_field_value.description: Self-tests run is skipped and results are not included.

bit_field.name: FIPS_DRBG_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for DRBG block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in BOOT_STATE register.

bit_field_value.name: SKIP_SELF_TEEST_RUN
bit_field_value.description: Self-tests run is skipped and results are not included.

bit_field.name: FIPS_ECDSA_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for ECDSA block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in BOOT_STATE register.

bit_field_value.name: SKIP_SELF_TEEST_RUN
bit_field_value.description: Self-tests run is skipped and results are not included.

bit_field.name: FIPS_AES_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for AES block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in BOOT_STATE register.

bit_field_value.name: SKIP_SELF_TEEST_RUN
bit_field_value.description: Self-tests run is skipped and results are not included.

bit_field.name: FIPS_SHA_STEN
bit_field.description: Enable self-test for SHA2 block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in BOOT_STATE register.

bit_field_value.name: SKIP_SELF_TEEST_RUN
bit_field_value.description: Self-tests run is skipped and results are not included.

bit_field.name: SKIP_PM_SIGN_VERIFCATION
bit_field.description: On boot-up from PM3/PM4, do not run through ECDSA signature verification of the image

register.name: BOOT_CFG5
register.description: The USB VID and PID can be customized by writing the new VID to the usbVid field and the new PID to the usbPid field in this OTP

bit_field.name: USB_VID
bit_field.description: Value of USB VID

bit_field.name: USB_PID
bit_field.description: Value of USB PID

register.name: BOOT_CFG6
register.description: the SDIO VID and PID can be customized by writing the new VID to the usbVid field and the new PID to the usbPid field in this OTP

bit_field.name: SDIO_VID
bit_field.description: Value of SDIO VID

bit_field.name: SDIO_PID
bit_field.description: Value of SDIO PID

register.name: SEC_BOOT_CFG0
register.description: Root key revocation

bit_field.name: REVOKE_ROOTKEY0
bit_field.description: RoT Key 0 enable

bit_field.name: REVOKE_ROOTKEY1
bit_field.description: RoT Key 1 enable

bit_field.name: REVOKE_ROOTKEY2
bit_field.description: RoT Key 2 enable

bit_field.name: REVOKE_ROOTKEY3
bit_field.description: RoT Key 3 enable

bit_field.name: FA_MODE_EN
bit_field.description:
Enable Fault Analysis mode.
- When set ROM checks and Erase all KEYS and IVs in KEYSTORE Flash page.
-Flush all temporary key registers.
- Issues zeroized command to PUF
- Blocks all HW routed OTP keys and set lock bits on those registers
- Enables all debug ports and waits in loop for tester.

register.name: SEC_BOOT_CFG1
register.description: DAP Vendor Usage configurations fuse word

bit_field.name: DAP_VENDOR_USAGE
bit_field.description: Lower 16-bits of Vendor Usage field in Debug Credentials defined in NXP's Debug Authentication Protocol specifications Version 1.0.

bit_field.name: Redundancy
bit_field.description: The word is set in redundant mode.

register.name: SEC_BOOT_CFG2
register.description: Lower 16-bits of revoke Image key configuration fuse word

bit_field.name: REVOKE_IMG_KEY[15:0]
bit_field.description: Image key revocation id

bit_field.name: Redundancy
bit_field.description: The word is set with redundant value.

register.name: SEC_BOOT_CFG3
register.description: Revoke Image key configuration fuse word

bit_field.name: REVOKE_IMG_KEY[31:16]
bit_field.description: Higher 16-bits of revoke Image key configuration fuse word

bit_field.name: Redundancy
bit_field.description: The word is set with redundant value.

register.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS
register.description:
The DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS configuration fields can be used to increase the restriction level specified in DCFG_CC_SOCU. With TZ-M, the part can be sold by level 1 customers (secure code developer) to level-2 customers who develops non-secure code only.
 - In this scenario, or easy of development, Level-I customer releases the part to always allow non-secure debug. 
 - To allow level-2 customers to further seal the part DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS is used.
 - ROM will use this word to further restrict the debug access.
 - Layout of this word is same as DCFG_CC_SOCU. 
 - Combinations of PINNED_xxxEN and DFLT_xxxEN bits and resulting access restriction levels are:
 
1. PINNED_xxxEN=1,DFLT_xxxEN=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product. 
2. PINNED_xxxEN=0,DFLT_xxxEN=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at startup. But the access can be enabled through the debug authentication process by providing an appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate. 
3. PINNED_xxxEN=0,DFLT_xxxEN=1: Illegal setting. Part will lock-up if this setting is selected. 
4. PINNED_xxxEN=1,DFLT_xxxEN=0: Restriction level 2. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and cannot be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bit_field.name: CRC8_NS[7:0]
bit_field.description: CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes (bits 8 to 31). Since these fields are security critical, they are constructed with built-in integrity protection to protect from side channel glitch attacks. The lower byte (0 to 7 bits) of these OTP words should be written with CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes (bits 8 to 31). This construction makes the probability of a successful glitch attack to flip the exact control bits extremely difficult. The CRC8 calculation should be based on x8 + x2 + x + 1 polynomial. Polynomial=0x07, initial value= 0x00, XorOut=0x55

bit_field.name: DFLT_NIDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0.

bit_field.name: DFLT_DBGEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0.

bit_field.name: DFLT_SPNIDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined secure domain of CPU0

bit_field.name: DFLT_SPIDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined secure domain of CPU0.

bit_field.name: DFLT_TAPEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls TAP (Test Access Point) controller used for structural integrity testing of silicon by NXP as part of Return Material Analysis (RMA)

bit_field.name: DFLT_CPU1NIDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of CPU1.

bit_field.name: DFLT_CPU1DBGEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of CPU1.

bit_field.name: DFLT_CPU2NIDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of CPU2.

bit_field.name: DFLT_CPU2DBGEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of CPU2.

bit_field.name: DFLT_ISPCMDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls whether ISP boot flow DM-AP command (command code: 0x05) can be issued after authentication.

bit_field.name: DFLT_FACMDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls whether DM-AP Set FA Mode command (command code: 0x06) can be issued after authentication

bit_field.name: PINNED_NIDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_DBGEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_SPNIDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined secure domain of CPU0

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_SPIDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined secure domain of CPU0

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_TAPEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls TAP (Test Access Point) controller used for structural integrity testing of silicon by NXP as part of Return Material Analysis (RMA)

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_CPU1NIDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of CPU1

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_CPU1DBGEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of CPU1.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_CPU2NIDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of CPU2.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_CPU2DBGEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of CPU2.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_ISPCMDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls whether ISP boot flow DM-AP command (command code: 0x05) can be issued after authentication.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_FACMDEN_NS
bit_field.description: Controls whether DM-AP Set FA Mode command (command code: 0x06) can be issued after authentication

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: FORCE_UUID_MATCH_NS
bit_field.description: When set, debug authentication protocol only accepts "Debug Credential" certificates (DC) with matching UUID.

register.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU
register.description:
The DCFG_CC_SOCU configuration field specifies the debug access restrictions per debug domain. The DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS fields can be used to increase the restriction level specified in DCFG_CC_SOCU but cannot be used to reduce the restriction level.
 - Combinations of PINNED_xxxEN and DFLT_xxxEN bits and resulting access restriction levels are:
 
1. PINNED_xxxEN=1,DFLT_xxxEN=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product. 
2. PINNED_xxxEN=0,DFLT_xxxEN=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at startup. But the access can be enabled through the debug authentication process by providing an appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate. 
3. PINNED_xxxEN=0,DFLT_xxxEN=1: Illegal setting. Part will lock-up if this setting is selected. 
4. PINNED_xxxEN=1,DFLT_xxxEN=0: Restriction level 2. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and cannot be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bit_field.name: CRC8[7:0]
bit_field.description: CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes (bits 8 to 31). Since these fields are security critical, they are constructed with built-in integrity protection to protect from side channel glitch attacks. The lower byte (0 to 7 bits) of these OTP words should be written with CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes (bits 8 to 31). This construction makes the probability of a successful glitch attack to flip the exact control bits extremely difficult. The CRC8 calculation should be based on x8 + x2 + x + 1 polynomial. Polynomial=0x07, initial value= 0x00, XorOut=0x55

bit_field.name: DFLT_NIDEN
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0.

bit_field.name: DFLT_DBGEN
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0.

bit_field.name: DFLT_SPNIDEN
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined secure domain of CPU0

bit_field.name: DFLT_SPIDEN
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined secure domain of CPU0.

bit_field.name: DFLT_TAPEN
bit_field.description: Controls TAP (Test Access Point) controller used for structural integrity testing of silicon by NXP as part of Return Material Analysis (RMA)

bit_field.name: DFLT_CPU1NIDEN
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of CPU1.

bit_field.name: DFLT_CPU1DBGEN
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of CPU1.

bit_field.name: DFLT_CPU2NIDEN
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of CPU2.

bit_field.name: DFLT_CPU2DBGEN
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of CPU2.

bit_field.name: DFLT_ISPCMDEN
bit_field.description: Controls whether ISP boot flow DM-AP command (command code: 0x05) can be issued after authentication.

bit_field.name: DFLT_FACMDEN
bit_field.description: Controls whether DM-AP Set FA Mode command (command code: 0x06) can be issued after authentication

bit_field.name: PINNED_NIDEN
bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: PINNED_DBGEN
bit_field.description: Controls invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.description: Controls non-Invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined secure domain of CPU0

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC

bit_field.description: Controls whether ISP boot flow DM-AP command (command code: 0x05) can be issued after authentication.

bit_field.name: PINNED_FACMDEN
bit_field.description: Controls whether DM-AP Set FA Mode command (command code: 0x06) can be issued after authentication

bit_field_value.name: DAR_CC
bit_field_value.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bit_field.name: FORCE_UUID_MATCH
bit_field.description: When set, debug authentication protocol only accepts "Debug Credential" certificates (DC) with matching UUID.

register.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_AP
register.description: Anti-pole (inverse) value of Debug Configuration word (DCFG_CC_SOCU). DCFG_CC_SOCU_AP should be programmed with the exact anti-pole (inverse value) value of DCFG_CC_SOCU. Any mismatch between DCFG_CC_SOCU and DCFG_CC_SOCU_AP is deemed as an attack and part will lock-up.

register.name: LIFE_CYCLE_STATE
register.description: Life cycle state of RW61x platform

bit_field.name: LCS[7:0]
bit_field.description: Possible values of RW61x lifecycle states

bit_field_value.name: Develop
bit_field_value.description: Initial customer development state after leaving NXP manufacturing.

bit_field_value.name: Develop2
bit_field_value.description: Optional customer development state. Used for development of NS world code.

bit_field_value.name: In-Field
bit_field_value.description: In-field application state for end-customer use.

bit_field_value.name: In-Field Locked
bit_field_value.description: Alternative in-field application state that prevents use of field return/failure analysis states. The rest of the behavior of the device is same as the In-field state.

bit_field_value.name: Shredded
bit_field_value.description: Bricked state to prevent device use.

bit_field.name: LCS_REDUNDANT[7:0]
bit_field.description: Repeat values of lifecycle state due to a security

bit_field_value.name: Develop
bit_field_value.description: Initial customer development state after leaving NXP manufacturing.

bit_field_value.name: Develop2
bit_field_value.description: Optional customer development state. Used for development of NS world code.

bit_field_value.name: In-Field
bit_field_value.description: In-field application state for end-customer use.

bit_field_value.name: In-Field Locked
bit_field_value.description: Alternative in-field application state that prevents use of field return/failure analysis states. The rest of the behavior of the device is same as the In-field state.

bit_field_value.name: Shredded
bit_field_value.description: Bricked state to prevent device use.

register.name: RKTH0
register.description:
SHA256 hash digest of hash of four Root Of Trust Keys (modulus || exponent).
For i in 0..3:
 Let M[i] = BE(Modulus i)
 Let E[i] = BE(Exponent i)
 Let RKH[i] = SHA256( M[i] || E[i] )
 Let RKTH = SHA256( RKH[0] || RKH[1] || RKH[2] || RKH[3] )
Note: Documentation update needed when using blhost due to endianness issue.
